introduction: Is learning languages good for you? For audio and transcript downloads, a quiz and a list of the wor

vocabulary.definition: a person who knows and is able to use several languages
vocabulary.example: Victoria is a polyglot who speaks five languages fluently.

vocabulary.definition: to listen or pay attention to something
vocabulary.example: Babies have to tune in to the languages around them to make sense of what people say.

vocabulary.definition: to cope with several things at the same time
vocabulary.example: Being a polyglot requires the ability to juggle multiple languages effortlessly.

vocabulary.definition: to continue doing something despite difficulties
vocabulary.example: Victoria's parents had to soldier on to learn Norwegian in their 50s.

vocabulary.definition: vast or very great in size, amount, or degree
vocabulary.example: The benefits of being a polyglot can have an immense impact on brain efficiency.

vocabulary.definition: to involve oneself deeply in a particular activity or place
vocabulary.example: Victoria recommended immersing yourself in the language by listening to native speakers.

vocabulary.definition: to summarize or review the main points
vocabulary.example: Let's recap the vocabulary we've learned today.

vocabulary.definition: able to express oneself easily and articulately in a language
vocabulary.example: After years of practice, Hannah became fluent in Spanish.
